title: Hall of Forgotten Toys Adventure #31
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Dusty Attic of Forgotten Toys
rooms.description: A dimly lit attic filled with cobwebs and shadows. Moonlight streams through a small round window, illuminating rows of forgotten toys covered in dust. A rocking horse sits motionless in the corner, and old toy boxes are stacked against the walls. The air smells of old wood and memories.

items.name: old toy chest
items.description: A large wooden chest painted with faded circus animals. Three compartments are visible inside.

items.name: child's diary
items.description: A small diary with a teddy bear on the cover
items.text: December 25th, 1955 - Best Christmas ever! Got Mr. Buttons the teddy bear, Sally the doll, and Rusty the tin soldier. Mom says I'm the luckiest kid in the world!

items.name: small brass key
items.description: A tiny brass key with a toy soldier engraved on it

items.name: antique dollhouse
items.description: A beautiful Victorian dollhouse with a small brass lock on the front door

items.name: letter to the toys
items.description: A handwritten letter on yellowed paper
items.text: Dear toys, I'm sorry I forgot about you. I grew up and moved away. But I remember: Mr. Buttons was my first friend. Sally lived in the dollhouse. Rusty guarded my toy kingdom. I hope you can forgive me. - Emily

items.name: wooden rocking horse
items.description: A weathered rocking horse with a gentle expression

items.name: silver key
items.description: A silver key shaped like a star

items.name: attic door
items.description: A wooden door leading down to the toy workshop. It has a star-shaped keyhole.

rooms.name: Moonlit Toy Workshop
rooms.description: A magical workshop where toys are repaired and brought back to life. Workbenches are covered with tools, paint, and fabric. Shelves display restored toys that seem to watch you with knowing eyes. A large jack-in-the-box sits in the center of the room, and a mysterious glowing door stands at the far end.

items.name: toy maker's workbench
items.description: A cluttered workbench with various toy-making supplies

items.name: toy repair manual
items.description: A worn manual with notes in the margins
items.text: Toy Restoration Guide: Remember the three rules - First, identify the toy's original owner. Second, know where each toy belonged. Third, understand each toy's purpose. Only then can a toy find peace.

items.name: shelf with teddy bear
items.description: A shelf displaying a restored teddy bear with button eyes
items.text: Name tag reads: 'Mr. Buttons - Beloved companion and first friend to Emily'

items.name: shelf with porcelain doll
items.description: A shelf holding a beautiful doll in a blue dress
items.text: Name tag reads: 'Sally - Resident of the Victorian dollhouse, keeper of tea parties'

items.name: shelf with tin soldier
items.description: A shelf displaying a proud tin soldier at attention
items.text: Name tag reads: 'Rusty - Guardian of the toy kingdom, protector of dreams'

items.name: large jack-in-the-box
items.description: A colorful jack-in-the-box with a crank handle on the side

items.name: golden key
items.description: A magical golden key that glows with warm light

items.name: glowing toy kingdom door
items.description: A magnificent door decorated with painted toys and stars. Three questions are carved into a brass plaque beside it.

password_questions.question: Who was the toys' original owner?
password_questions.hint: Check the letter in the dollhouse

password_questions.question: Where did Sally live?
password_questions.hint: Read the name tags on the shelves in the workshop

password_questions.question: What was Rusty's purpose?
password_questions.hint: Look at Rusty's description on his shelf

rooms.name: The Eternal Toy Kingdom
rooms.description: You have entered a magical realm where forgotten toys live forever! A beautiful landscape of toy castles, candy forests, and rainbow skies stretches before you. Mr. Buttons, Sally, and Rusty stand together, smiling and waving. They are no longer forgotten - they are home, and they are happy. A shimmering portal of light offers your way back to the real world.

items.name: magnificent toy castle
items.description: A grand castle made of building blocks and dreams, where all forgotten toys find peace

items.name: reunited toys
items.description: Mr. Buttons, Sally, and Rusty stand together, finally at peace in their eternal home

items.name: book of memories
items.description: A magical book that records every child's love for their toys
items.text: Every toy that was ever loved lives on in the Toy Kingdom. They are never truly forgotten, for they live in the hearts and memories of those who cherished them.

rooms.win_message: You have helped the forgotten toys find their way home to the Eternal Toy Kingdom! Mr. Buttons, Sally, and Rusty are finally at peace, reunited in a place where they will never be forgotten again. As you step through the shimmering portal, you carry with you the knowledge that every cherished toy lives on in memory and magic. You win!
